revisions.*:
'''Joanna Connor''' (born August 31, 1962 in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City|New York]], [[United States]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[Chicago]]-based [[blues]] [[singing|singer]], [[songwriter]], and [[guitarist]].

Joanna Connor was drawn to the [[Chicago blues]] scene in the early 1980s, eventually sharing the stage with [[James Cotton]], [[Junior Wells]], [[Buddy Guy]], and [[A.C. Reed]]. By 1987, she had started her own band, and [[sound recording and reproduction|recorded]] her first [[album]] for [[Blind Pig Records]] in 1989.<ref name=allmusic/>

==Discography==
*1989 ''Believe It!''
*1992 ''Fight''
*1993 ''Living On The Road'' ([[live album]])
*1995 ''Rock & Roll Gypsy''
*1996 ''Big Girl Blues''
*1998 ''Slidetime''
*2001 ''Nothing But The Blues'' (live)
*2002 ''The Joanna Connor Band''
